results.title: Bip hunts butterflies
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, John Barnes Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Tragic comic mime by Marcel Marceau in which his character Bip discovers how fragile life can be - as is the fragile butterfly held in his hands. His concern for the dying butterfly is expressed with a range of emotional responses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Barnes, John Barnes Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bip at a society party; Bip hunts butterflies; The Cage
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Marcel Marceau introduces the art of mime through the character of Bip. “Bip at a society party” portrays many amusing characters encountered at a party. “Bip hunts butterflies” is a tragic comic mime in which Bip discovers how fragile life can be. “The Cage” is an allegorical pantomime of a person struggling to escape from confinement.
results.title_for_label: Bip at a society party; Bip hunts butterflies; The Cage

results.title: Bip at a society party
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, John Barnes Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
In this Bip pantomime, Marcel Marceau portrays many amusing characters encountered at a society party. Invisible people become visible with sightless props. Bip leans against the mantlepiece and eats, smiles sociably and enters into the spirit of the party.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Barnes, John Barnes Productions and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
A compilation tape featuring Marcel Marceau, introducing the art of mime through the characater of Bip. “Bip as a soldier” shows the soldier as a tragic and heroic figure. “The Hands” is an allegory of the struggle between good and evil. The serious tone is lightened by the interpretation of “The Painter”.
results.title_for_label: Bip as a soldier; The Hands; The Painter.

results.title: Bionics: man or machine
results.creator_credit: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a brief history of bionics, the science of copying nature. Examines some of the successful machines that have been created as a result of bionic research, and investigates some possibilities for the future. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alan P. Sloan and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Bioncle: mask of light
results.creator_credit: Sue Shakespeare, The Lego Group, Miramax Films, David Molina and Terry Shakespeare
results.brief_description: CGI animated feature about robot creatures called Bionicles who live by a code of Unity, Duty and Destiny. ‘Chronicle’ finds a hidden mask that is the mask of light - he must take this mask to find his destiny which is to be the 7th Toa. A good versus evil battle evolves as light battles with the dark Master of Shadow in a bid to free the island home of Mata Nui from darkness. Made by the Lego Company and sure to be enjoyed by young purchasers of BionicleTM products. Direction and Art Direction by David Molina and Terry Shakespeare with a screenplay by Henry Gilroy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Shakespeare, The Lego Group, Miramax Films, David Molina and Terry Shakespeare

results.title: Biomagnetism
results.creator_credit: Brian Beaton, Celia Tait, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program looks at magnetic field therapy, an approach much researched, particularly in Japan. Biomagnetic therapy combined with drug therapy has been used to successfully treat depression, dementia, non-healing fractures and spinal injuries.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Beaton, Celia Tait, SBS-TV and Reel Images

results.title: Biology program; unit 3. Animal life
results.brief_description: Series of programs intended for upper secondary level students. Introduces the study of animal life and provides examples of structure, life cycle, behavior and adaptation of various animal groups, eg amphibians, mammals, reptiles etc.
